4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
4.row: Hambu 'aka' 'a dala' ESA fo hei parlu mihine so'al ta'o bee fo koronavirus a

12.row: Virus a dai atahori, lele' oe titi' ia ra,

13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
13.row: Mu'ud'od'oo'! Meter 2 fo fe'e na nda dai oe titi monae' sa.

17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
17.row: Dad'i, mete ma mita atahori esa boo, 'esufani, namahed'i na:

18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
18.row: Fee se masker. Ara bisa boo do 'esufani neu e, naa fo 'afi' dai atahori mana deka-deka' ra.

22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
22.row: Mbei ma ana nda namahed'i sa te ana  nanea ao na mia hed'is.

23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
23.row: La'e faa na atahori mana dai koronovirus a nda natud'u tanda sa, te ana bisa tao atahori laen dai koronavirus.

24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
24.row: Boe ma, malole lena' mu'ud'odoo' mia atahori mana ma'ab'ub'ue' ra, huu nda muhine atahori bee mamahed'i' sa.

32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask

38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
38.row: Te la'e faa na, atahori mamahed'i' esa mirun bisa dai sud'i a saa laen ra.

40.row: do atahori fo hoo sue' ra mata na ra.

42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
42.row: Ma mete ma, hoo nda sangaja sa, te nggama dai sud'i 'a saa, naa ra, basa ma nggama mata ma,

43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
43.row: ma hambu 'aka' dala malole' esa fo tamopo' virus ra, naeni safe hendi se tendi' sab'u, pemutih, do alkohol.

44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
44.row: Virus ra bisa ra'atataa' losa jam hira sia sud'i 'a saa ra,

47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these
47.row: Naa de malole lena' ata tao tungga dala-dala pencegahan ia ra.

48.eng: wash with soap up to here

51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
51.row: 'Afi' nggama mata ma. (Do atahori laen mata na ra.) Mete ma hoo musi nggama, na, safe malolole basa lima ma ra mendi' sab'u dei.

52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
52.row: Naa doo na 'ona' hita sod'a sosod'a fai bob'onggi' lao rua.

55.row: Safe lima 'u'u ma ra talad'a na ra.

56.eng: wash the back of your hands
56.row: Safe lima ma ra dea na ra.

58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
58.row: Mete ma nggama dai masker a dea', na, 'afi' dud'ua nae'. Sad'i basa na safe lima ma ra mendi' sab'u.

59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
59.row: Boe ma, kalo bisa na 'afi' nggama masker a dea'.

61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
61.row: *Bakteri ra mori sia masker ra rala' mete ma hita pake se losa doo' talalu.

62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
62.row: Nggari hendi masker ra, mete ma rasa ara manggenggeo' ena. 'Afi' pake se lena' fai esa.

68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
68.row: 'Afi' mia mi'ib'ue nanaat, ma pake mi'ib'ue sud'i 'a sa ra, mok, handuk.

69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
69.row: Mae hoo sob'a o, hoo nda bisa nggama mata ma mendi' lima buku ma sa.

70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
70.row: Kalu bisa na, buka ma 'ena lelesu ra mendi' lima buku ma do mbili ma ra.

72.eng: and after being out in the public

74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…
74.row: Safe lima ma ra mendi' sab'u nakandoo 'a.

77.row: Basa nggi minea ao ma ra!

78.row: Basa nggi minea ao ma ra!

80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!
80.row: Baca artikel a fo hambu tamba mahine'!

81.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

82.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)

83.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

85.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com
85.row:
Catatan tambahan: Dala pencegahan sia komik ia malole' soa' neu hed'i menular nae', 'ona' a masanasi. Dad'i ata musi tao tungga fai-fai esa, mae hed'is ia nese ena.
Referensi: Informasi sia komik ia lao' mia pemahaman so'al COVID19 losa tanggal 28 Februari 2020, nanaen tungga referensi katelu' ia ra. 
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.html﻿https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10  
Catatan tambahan: hita bisa download komik ia versi PDF na sia: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart
Petunjuk untuk banggi komik ia: Masyarakat umum bisa banggi komik ia  online (nda pake bae sa), ma tungga Whatsapp noo Telegram, ma bisa download nda pake bae sa fo print pake soa' neu nenori' sia ume, sakola' ma mamana kerja.
Mete ma tae banggi na tasaned'a dala' katelu' ia ra: 1) 'Afi' ed'it komik a. 2) Nda bole seo komik a sa. 3) Kalu tae banggi online na, tasaned'a fee kredit soa' neu mana tulis a, tungga FB na tag @weimankowart, tungga IG na tag @weimankow (IG), do tungga link instagram com/weimankow.

bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
Chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap
Read the articles for more tips!
"This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
"The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

bookText.row:
So'al Koronavirus



Hambu 'aka' 'a dala' ESA fo hei parlu mihine so'al ta'o bee fo koronavirus a
dai atahori hetar.
bafa ma
mbana ma
mata ma
maso' nisi'
Atahori nda mamahed'i' sa
Atahori mamahed'i'
Virus a dai atahori, lele' oe titi' ia ra,
Mu'ud'od'oo'! Meter 2 fo fe'e na nda dai oe titi monae' sa.
1
meter 2
Acii!
Dad'i, mete ma mita atahori esa boo, 'esufani, namahed'i na:
Fee se masker. Ara bisa boo do 'esufani neu e, naa fo 'afi' dai atahori mana deka-deka' ra.
2
Makasi nae'!﻿*boo ho'u-ho'u*
DO,
Mbei ma ana nda namahed'i sa te ana  nanea ao na mia hed'is.
La'e faa na atahori mana dai koronovirus a nda natud'u tanda sa, te ana bisa tao atahori laen dai koronavirus.
Boe ma, malole lena' mu'ud'odoo' mia atahori mana ma'ab'ub'ue' ra, huu nda muhine atahori bee mamahed'i' sa.
Susurut
Atahori nda mamahed'i' sa
Toto'u' sia Kareta do bemo
Lift a tetendes na
Tisu
Mok
Sud'i' a saa elektronik
& hita masker na dean boe.
Tangga ra toto'u na
Mous
Bolpoin
Lelesu toto'u na
Lima na ra
Te la'e faa na, atahori mamahed'i' esa mirun bisa dai sud'i a saa laen ra.
Basa nggi bisa mimihed'i.
do atahori fo hoo sue' ra mata na ra.
'o'ose mata ma ra,
Ma mete ma, hoo nda sangaja sa, te nggama dai sud'i 'a saa, naa ra, basa ma nggama mata ma,
ma hambu 'aka' dala malole' esa fo tamopo' virus ra, naeni safe hendi se tendi' sab'u, pemutih, do alkohol.
Virus ra bisa ra'atataa' losa jam hira sia sud'i 'a saa ra,
Sab'u

Naa de malole lena' ata tao tungga dala-dala pencegahan ia ra.
Safe mendi' sab'u losa ia.
Sab'u
Lima buku'
'Afi' nggama mata ma. (Do atahori laen mata na ra.) Mete ma hoo musi nggama, na, safe malolole basa lima ma ra mendi' sab'u dei.
Naa doo na 'ona' hita sod'a sosod'a fai bob'onggi' lao rua.
Lima 'u'u' ra rala na.
Losa detik 20.
Safe lima 'u'u ma ra talad'a na ra.
Safe lima ma ra dea na ra.
Safe malolole na 'ona' bee?
Mete ma nggama dai masker a dea', na, 'afi' dud'ua nae'. Sad'i basa na safe lima ma ra mendi' sab'u.
Boe ma, kalo bisa na 'afi' nggama masker a dea'.
Oe titi' ra.
*Bakteri ra mori sia masker ra rala' mete ma hita pake se losa doo' talalu.
Nggari hendi masker ra, mete ma rasa ara manggenggeo' ena. 'Afi' pake se lena' fai esa.
Pake sosod'et.
Anadiki'
Papa
Mama
Esa' handuk na.
'Afi' mia mi'ib'ue nanaat, ma pake mi'ib'ue sud'i 'a sa ra, mok, handuk.
Mae hoo sob'a o, hoo nda bisa nggama mata ma mendi' lima buku ma sa.
Kalu bisa na, buka ma 'ena lelesu ra mendi' lima buku ma do mbili ma ra.
Ume
ma bali' mia mamana umum.
Sebelum mua,
Safe lima ma ra mendi' sab'u nakandoo 'a.
Dad'i,
sab'u
Basa nggi minea ao ma ra!
Basa nggi minea ao ma ra!
sab'u
Baca artikel a fo hambu tamba mahine'!

summary: This book gives basic advice on dealing with the coronavirus COVID 19
title: So'al Koronavirus
